Sentencas: This work aims at the investigation and optimization of a hybrid start-up process for a self-sustained reactor for n-butane to syngas conversion in intermediate temperature, micro-solid oxide fuel cell (micro-SOFC) power plants.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: The catalytic reaction is carried out in the presence of Rh-doped Ce0.5Zr0.5O2 nanoparticles in a disk-shaped reactor.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: For the start-up, a resistance heater is embedded inside the catalytic bed and is activated until the exothermic oxidative reaction is initiated.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: The self-sustained temperature and reforming performance are demonstrated to be highly dependent on the fuel to oxygen (C/O) ratio and the catalytic activity at different space times.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: It is shown that a C/O ratio of 0.8 is a very good choice in terms of achieved steady-state temperature, syngas selectivity and start-up time.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: At a reactor inlet temperature of 809 degrees C for a C/O ratio of 0.8 and a space time as low as 8 ms, a syngas selectivity of 69.6% and a temperature of 529 degrees C at the simulated micro-SOFC membrane are demonstrated.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: After only 15 s from ignition, a temperature of 600 degrees C at the reactor inlet is reached.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants

Sentencas: The hybrid start-up process is optimized with respect to a specific setup as an example, but is of general nature and utility to similar systems.
Titulo: A fast hybrid start-up process for thermally self-sustained catalytic n-butane reforming in micro-SOFC power plants
